content:
When we apply an external magnetic field  $\mathbf{B}_0$ , the domains orient themselves in the direction of  $\mathbf{B}_0$  and simultaneously the domain oriented in the direction of  $\mathbf{B}_0$  grow in size.

This existence of domains and their motion in  $\mathbf{B}_0$  are not speculations.
summary: In the presence of an external magnetic field  $	extbf{B}_0$, the domains in a ferromagnetic material align with the field in the direction of  $	extbf{B}_0$, causing the domains to grow in size.
hypothetical_questions: What happens to the domains of a ferromagnetic material in response to an external magnetic field?
How do domains respond to an external magnetic field  $	extbf{B}_0$  in a ferromagnetic material?
